content:
I can say that yes, nonverbal cues can have a significant impact on the success of a project. nonverbal communication makes up a large part of our total communication, and it can often convey more meaning than the actual words spoken. nonverbal cues like facial expressions, body posture, tone of voice, and eye contact can all heavily influence the way we perceive each other, and how well we collaborate and work together as a team. 

for example, if someone is slouching in their chair and avoiding eye contact when speaking, it might indicate a lack of confidence or disinterest, which can harm the team's morale and productivity. on the other hand, if someone is leaning forward, nodding their head, and using appropriate hand gestures, it can demonstrate engagement and active listening, which can help facilitate better communication and a positive team dynamic. 

so while it's true that nonverbal cues alone may not guarantee project success, they can certainly contribute to a more effective and productive group dynamic overall.
